sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jane Doe is being referred to the General Medicine Clinic for further evaluation of persistent fatigue and unexplained weight loss over the past three months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports experiencing increasing fatigue, generalized weakness, and a 6 kg unintentional weight loss since February 2025. She denies fever, night sweats, or recent infections. There is no history of recent travel, gastrointestinal symptoms, or changes in appetite. She has no known chronic illnesses and is not on any regular medications.

sections.heading: Assessment
sections.content: On examination, Ms. Doe appears mildly pale but is otherwise well. Vital signs are stable. Laboratory investigations from the last two weeks indicate mild microcytic anemia (Hb 10.2 g/dL), normal renal and liver function, and negative screening for thyroid dysfunction. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly was noted.

sections.heading: Plan
sections.content: Referral to General Medicine is requested for comprehensive assessment, including possible further hematological workup, imaging as indicated, and consideration of referral to other specialties if necessary. Please advise regarding further diagnostic and management steps.
